author: Attractions Magazine Staff
title: 2024 D23 Gold Member gift is full of magic and mystery
text: 2024 D23 Gold Member gift is full of magic and mystery This year’s gift for new and renewing D23 Gold Members is a [Magic & Mystery Box Collector Set](https://d23.com/collector-set-2024/) that contains a range of fun Disney items. By Allyson Koerner The 2024 D23 Gold Member gift includes a Sorcerer Mickey figurine, a second mystery figurine, two mystery [pins](https://attractionsmagazine.com/pin-tastic-tuesdays-unveil-new-disney-pins-each-week/), a deck of playing cards, and a membership card and certificate. D23 Gold Member Collectible Figurines The 6-inch Sorcerer Mickey figurine was designed in collaboration with Gentle Giant Studios and is, of course, inspired by Mickey’s most legendary film role in “The Sorcerer’s Apprentice.” The gift also includes one of four magical character figurines, but which one remains a mystery until you open your box. Some lucky D23 Gold Members will even receive a rare glitter variant of each character. The figurines range from five to seven inches tall and were also designed by Gentle Giant Studios: - The Genie – “Aladdin” (1992) - Maleficent – “Sleeping Beauty” (1959) - Merlin – “The Sword in the Stone” (1963) - Mama Odie – “The Princess and the Frog” (2009) D23 Enchanted Object Pins The box also includes two of the following seven “enchanted object” sculpted pins: - Genie’s Lamp – “Aladdin” (1992) - King Triton’s Trident – “The Little Mermaid” (1989) - Madame Leota’s Crystal Ball – Haunted Mansion attraction - Maui’s Fishhook – “Moana” (2016) - Miguel’s Guitar – “Coco” (2017) - The Madrigal Family Candle – “Encanto” (2021) - Yzma’s Llama Potion – “The Emperor’s New Groove” (2000) Last but not least, the D23 Deck of Destiny Playing Cards features imaginative illustrations of magical characters and creatures from Disney Animation. Membership Card and Certificate Whether D23 Gold Members renew or purchase a brand new membership, they will receive an updated membership card and certificate featuring Sorcerer Mickey. If you want to collect all the character collectible figurines and magical object pins, mystery boxes will be available exclusively to D23 Gold Members later in the year. Click [here](https://d23.com/join/) to learn about becoming a D23 Gold Member.

author: @agensir
title: Israele e Hamas: Via Crucis a Gerusalemme, mille studenti sulla Via Dolorosa per chiedere la pace - AgenSIR
text: Oggi secondo venerdì di Quaresima, 140° giorno di guerra a Gaza tra Hamas e Israele, oltre 1000 alunni e studenti delle Scuole cristiane di Gerusalemme hanno camminato lungo la Via Dolorosa della Città Santa, pregando la “Via Crucis” mai come questa mattina trasformata in una “Via della Pace” lungo la quale si sono alzate invocazioni per la fine della guerra e la grazia della riconciliazione. Tensione palpabile. Erano presenti, con esponenti delle varie denominazioni cristiane e il nunzio apostolico, mons. Adolfo Tito Yllana, anche i ragazzi e i bambini di quattro Scuole della Custodia di Terra Santa, come racconta al Sir, padre Ibrahim Faltas, vicario custodiale e responsabile delle scuole di Terra Santa della Custodia. Nelle strade della Città vecchia di Gerusalemme, in una tensione palpabile dopo l’attentato di ieri (con tre vittime – un israeliano e due attentatori palestinesi – compiuto vicino a Maale Adumim, su una strada che collega un insediamento israeliano a Gerusalemme, ndr.), “è spiccato il colore bianco delle sciarpe dei bambini, bianche come le colombe liberate per implorare la pace sulla Terra Santa e sul mondo”. Partiti dal convento della Flagellazione, spiega padre Faltas, “i partecipanti hanno pregato le prime otto Stazioni lungo la via Dolorosa della Città Vecchia, mentre le ultime sei Stazioni sono state meditate al convento di San Salvatore, insieme al Custode di Terra Santa, padre Francesco Patton. “Lungo la via Dolorosa, ripercorrendo le Stazioni che fanno memoria della passione e morte di Cristo, abbiamo ricordato la sua sofferenza e lanciato un appello di pace. I bambini e i ragazzi di Terra Santa – aggiunge il vicario della Custodia – conoscono dalla nascita limiti e privazioni che negli ultimi cinque mesi sono purtroppo aumentati e oggi, più che mai, dobbiamo ascoltare la loro voce e la loro richiesta”. Per questo motivo, sottolinea padre Faltas, “la Via Crucis di oggi è stata speciale perché ha inviato un messaggio importante al mondo: nelle meditazioni i giovani percorrono la via del Dolore che, attraverso la Speranza della Resurrezione, diventa via della Pace”. “Sono state meditazioni sentite e profonde che rivelano la loro sofferenza per la tragica situazione di Gaza. I loro coetanei di Gaza stanno morendo di fame perché non arrivano gli aiuti umanitari; stanno morendo di sete perché non esistono più le condutture o sono state inquinate e i bambini bevono l’acqua delle pozzanghere; stanno morendo di freddo perché non hanno abiti caldi e questo è il periodo più freddo dell’anno, si riparano e dormono in tende umide di pioggia; stanno morendo per la mancanza di igiene e di cure perché non esistono più ospedali”. Spezzare le catene dell’odio. Durante il cammino, prosegue il francescano, “i giovani partecipanti hanno espresso tutto il loro desiderio di vivere in pace e in sicurezza, e chiesto al Signore una vita nuova, la dignità della verità e della giustizia. Chiedono di essere aiutati a spezzare le catene di odio e di violenza attraverso la forza dell’amore. Come il Cireneo, gli studenti delle scuole cristiane hanno portato la Croce, per essere più vicini alla sofferenza del prossimo chiedendo a Gesù di imparare a perdonare perché il perdono è un atto d’amore”. Le meditazioni delle Stazioni hanno ricordato “i bambini orfani di guerra, pregando che il Signore conceda loro l’accoglienza, l’affetto e la sicurezza di una nuova famiglia. Sono state elevate preghiere perché tutti i bambini del mondo possano continuare a sperare nel futuro reso precario e incerto da chi dovrebbe dare loro protezione e cura”. Arrivati a san Salvatore gli studenti, con i loro insegnanti, hanno ricevuto il saluto del Custode di Terra Santa, padre Francesco Patton: “Abbiamo camminato sulle pietre che Gesù ha calpestato 2000 anni fa mentre portava la croce verso il Calvario. Nel dare la vita per noi Egli ha sentito tutta la sofferenza dell’umanità, anche quella che sentiamo noi oggi, quella dei bambini di Gaza, di Palestina e di Israele e di tantissimi altri paesi del mondo”. Poi l’esortazione a “essere discepoli di Gesù e seguire le sue orme. Per questo domandiamo a lui la grazia di tenere sempre il cuore libero dall’odio e dal desiderio di vendetta contro chi ci fa il male. Chiediamo la grazia che tutti i muri fatti di inimicizia e di odio vengano demoliti e si costruiscano ponti di riconciliazione tra le persone, tra i popoli, tra i credenti di tutte le religioni”. “I bambini e i ragazzi della Terra Santa – conclude padre Faltas – hanno dato senso, sostanza e speranza alla parola pace. A noi adulti rimane la responsabilità di ascoltarli”.

author: CBS 8 Staff
title: "Aztecs for Life" Blood Drive at San Diego State University | cbs8.com
text:
SAN DIEGO — CBS 8 was proud to work with the American Red Cross and SDSU for the 8th annual ”Aztecs for Life Blood Drive” on Wednesday, November 13, 2024 at Viejas Arena. The blood collected at the drive will help treat cancer patients, trauma victims, surgery patients, and others requiring blood transfusions in our area.
The 2024 drive broke a record that has stood for 8 years by collecting 401 units of blood! Each unit can save up to 3 lives so this drive has the potential to help more than 1,200 people.
Hailed as the largest annual collegiate blood drive in the state, “Aztecs for Life” will take place from 9 am to 6 pm at Viejas Arena on the campus of San Diego State University . As a thank you, those who come to donate will receive a free t-shirt and a $10 gift card by email.
There are still a few spots left. To make your appointment today, go to GoAztecs.com/BloodDrive or RedCrossBlood.org .
Aztecs for Life Blood Drive
San Diego State University - Viejas Arena Wednesday, November 13 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. 5500 Canyon Crest Drive "Aztecs for Life" Blood Drive | Largest annual collegiate blood drive in the state
2023 Event Recap The 7th annual Aztecs for Life blood drive was a success in 2023, but you can still help! There’s an urgent need for blood of all types in San Diego and to find a Red Cross drive near you, just go to www.redcrossblood.org and enter your zip code to make an appointment.
This drive is the largest one-day collegiate blood drive in California with the goal is to collect more than 350 blood donations which could save more than 1,000 people. Those who donate will receive a free shirt and an exclusive pair of Elf and Red Cross socks.
RECAP: Aztecs for Life Blood Drive 2022 Thank you San Diego! Because of you the Aztecs for Life Blood Drive with CBS 8, The CW San Diego, SDSU and the Red Cross had a fantastic turnout at the November event.
The 2022 drive collected a total of 339 units of blood which can help save the lives up more than 1,000 people in need!
However, there is still a critical need for blood in our community and there are many other opportunities to schedule an appointment to donate.
Blood drives are an essential service providing a medical necessity to hospital patients. Donors of all blood types are urged to help overcome an emergency blood shortage.
To make an appointment to donate, please visit the links below:
Make an appointment with the RED CROSS
Make an appointment with the SAN DIEGO BLOOD BANK
THANK YOU for helping us serve the greater good of our Community!
More Videos Next up in 5

The "Aztecs for Life" Blood Drive was a success in November 2021! CBS 8, The CW San Diego, SDSU and the Red Cross teamed up to bring you the largest blood drive in the state of California on November 16, 2021!
Due to the overwhelming support of the San Diego community, all reservations were booked for the " Aztecs for Life" blood drive at Viejas Arena on the campus of SDSU.
Just because this current blood drive was at capacity, there is still a shortage of blood in our community and there are many other opportunities to schedule an appointment to donate.
Blood drives are an essential service providing a medical necessity to hospital patients. Donors of all blood types are urged to help overcome an emergency blood shortage.

author: hola.com
title: 'I apologise to all Kimbo Slice fans'…Tik Tok star Bryce Hall vows to land upset in BKFC comeback against legend's son
text:
Bryce Hall is supremely confident ahead of his Bare Knuckle FC showdown with ‘Baby Slice’ Kevin Ferguson Jr.
Bryce Hall emerged as the latest addition to influencer boxing when he debuted in the ring in June 2021. More than three years after his first appearance in the ring, Hall has a showdown with the son of a street-fighting legend on his radar for his return to Bare Knuckle FC.
Hall’s BKFC debut went superbly last year when he finished Gee Perez by doctor’s stoppage at BKFC 48. It was Hall’s first professional bare-knuckle fight and he solidified himself as another intriguing name on the BKFC roster.
Hall will return to the BKFC ring next month against Kevin Ferguson Jr., the son of MMA legend Kimbo Slice. Hall wants to put an end to Ferguson’s combat sports career and surpass him in the BKFC hierarchy.
READ MORE: Dana White names his four top MMA fighters including Jon Jones and other UFC legends Photo by Michael Reaves/Getty Images Bryce Hall sends a message to ‘Baby Slice’ ahead of BKFC return During a recent interview with DAZN , Hall sent a message to Ferguson and his vocal fanbase.
“This time I’m going to solidify another major upset in BKFC history,” Hall said. “I apologize to all Kimbo Slice fans when I’m about to do to him.
“I wanted to see Kimbo in person, and it’s just majorly disrespectful [he didn’t show up]. I have no words other than I’m going to do my thing on January 25th.”
The 32-year-old Ferguson didn’t appear for a scheduled face-to-face with Hall at BKFC Hollywood. His upcoming BKFC booking with Hall is his bare-knuckle boxing debut, after an MMA stint in Bellator and his professional boxing debut last year.
Ferguson is 3-3 in his MMA career and is still searching for his first victory in boxing. He lost to Okema Jibunor at MF & DAZN X Series 6 by second-round TKO.
READ MORE: Claressa Shields explains why she won’t take MMA fight with Cris Cyborg amid calls for crossover boxing clash Bryce Hall faces Kimbo Slice’s son at BKFC: KnuckleMania 5 Hall is an American media personality with over 23.6 million followers on TikTok, and a 3.29 million following on YouTube. He’s hinted that his upcoming match with Ferguson will be the last fight of his short-lived combat sports run.
Ferguson’s father, Kimbo Slice (Kevin Ferguson Sr.), is a street-fighting pioneer after his backyard brawls accumulated millions of views online. He also made a name for himself on The Ultimate Fighter 10, competing alongside the likes of Roy Nelson, Brendan Schaub, and Justin Wren.
Kimbo Slice made his UFC debut on the TUF 10 Finale, defeating Houston Alexander by unanimous decision. He lost to Matt Mitrone by second-round stoppage at UFC 113, his final fight with the promotion.
Hall is looking to steal the Slice spotlight at BKFC’s show in Philadelphia next month.
READ MORE: Sean Strickland shares Christmas reunion with former best friend after bitter public fallout as he prepares for UFC 312 title fight

author: RF Culiacán
title: Reconoce la ONU perspectiva de género en gobierno de Rubén Rocha Moya | Radio Fórmula
text: Culiacán, Sinaloa 11 de julio de 2024.- Sinaloa ya tiene un avance muy importante en la transversalización de la perspectiva de género en sus procesos presupuestales, reconoció la oficial nacional de la Unidad de Desarrollo Social y Económico del Programa de Naciones Unidas para el Desarrollo (PNUD), Cinthia Martínez Domínguez, por lo que felicitó al gobernador Rubén Rocha Moya por esa voluntad política que está ya plasmada en la política presupuestal de su administración. El mandatario estatal recibió en Palacio de Gobierno a la representante del PNUD, organismo perteneciente a la ONU, quien visitó Sinaloa para presentar la Estrategia para Fortalecer la Transversalización de la Perspectiva de Género y la Participación Ciudadana en los Ejercicios de Presupuestación Local, la cual se elaboró con la colaboración del Grupo Banorte, por lo que la funcionaria se hizo acompañar por el director general de Banca de Gobierno, Estados y Municipios de dicha institución, Samir Abud Espinoza. Al darle la bienvenida y luego de presenciar la exposición de la Estrategia que hizo la representante de la ONU, el gobernador Rocha coincidió en la necesidad de que todos los gobiernos atiendan dicha perspectiva de género, en correspondencia a una civilidad política, pues así es como lo manda el mundo moderno y civilizado. “El tema de considerar la perspectiva de género tiene que ver con la civilidad política, nosotros estamos comprometidos con eso, y estas cosas nos ayudan a empujar; la convicción la tenemos, que eso es lo más importante, y la convicción no es otra cosa que voluntad política, quien no tiene voluntad política para hacer las cosas, pues no. Tenemos que caminar hacia la igualdad, ya ni siquiera hacia la perspectiva, la igualdad es más”, comentó. El gobernador Rocha recordó que su gobierno es el primero en la historia de Sinaloa en contar con un gabinete totalmente paritario, es decir, con un mismo número de hombres y mujeres como titulares de las diferentes Secretarías que lo componen. “Hemos caminado, es el primer gabinete paritario que tenemos, pero lo que tiene que ver con lo sustantivo, alejado de lo aritmético, es también convicción nuestra”. A su vez, la oficial nacional del PNUD, Cinthia Martínez, explicó que el objetivo de crear esta Estrategia es para promover que los gobiernos locales de México integren la perspectiva de género y la participación ciudadana en la documentación y en los lineamientos propios, y en su presupuestación local. Dijo que lo se busca es identificar que la normatividad estatal en materia de planeación, presupuestación y programación, tenga un grado de implementación de perspectiva de género, y de acuerdo a los análisis se coloca a la entidad en uno de los cuatro niveles, siendo el primero donde no se contempla en absoluto, hasta la asignación de facultades, atribuciones y responsabilidades, y proporciona elementos mínimos para su transversalización.

author: VNExplorer
title: Freezing rain switching to snow later Friday, with snowfall warnings for some areas
text:
Freezing rain and rain continue across much of southern and central New Brunswick on Friday morning, with ice buildup in some areas.
CBC meteorologist Tina Simpkin said the type of precipitation varies across the province, depending on temperature and location.
Freezing rain warnings are still in place for areas named on Thursday by Environment Canada, from Woodstock to the Moncton area.
But some scattered regions now have snowfall warnings as well.
Fundy National Park and Moncton and southeast New Brunswick now have a snowfall warning on top of a freezing rain warning.
Scattered areas, including Moncton, have snowfall warnings in place with 15 to 20 centimetres expected. (Ken Hébert/Radio-Canada)
Kouchibouguac National Park and Kent County have snowfall warnings, but no freezing rain warnings.
The mix of freezing rain and rain is expected to end Friday morning, changing over to snow.
For the areas with a snowfall warning, 15 to 20 centimetres is expected, ending tonight, according to Environment Canada.
Simpkin said other regions of the province will get about two to five centimetres.

author: BLADE STAFF
title: UAW Local 14 finalizes new contract with GM - NewsBreak
text: United Auto Workers Local 14 has reached a new collective bargaining agreement with General Motors that includes a $200 million investment into the Toledo factory. Tony Totty, the president of Local 14, said the union and company finalized the agreement in the past month. It will expire with the national agreement on May 1, 2028. Among the accomplishments, Mr. Totty promoted a $200 million investment that will increase transmission capacity at the factory. “It means we can alleviate some of the heavy overtime that we have by spreading the work and having new equipment create more components so the line can run smoother,” the union president said. Mr. Totty said union members will also be able to split their five personal days, using them as vacation days. Now members will have 10 days in addition to the other vacation time they already receive. The union president said the agreement is a “weight off our shoulders” and credited Jeff King, the shop chairman on the bargaining team. It was Mr. King’s fourth local agreement, and he was at the national bargaining table for the 2019-2023 agreement as well. The union has been bargaining since the previous agreement’s expiration in 2023. “You know, we had our demands, and we weren’t going to settle for a contract that our members didn’t think was a good one, so it took a long time to negotiate,” Mr. Totty said. Although it took about two years, Mr. Totty said many other local unions don’t have a local agreement yet, adding that it speaks volumes of Local 14’s “great membership.” “They wouldn’t want to invest into a bad work force, which we are not,” Mr. Totty said. “We’re a very good work force, and they see the value in putting more dollars into Toledo, and that’s good for our whole community.” Subscribe to The Blade
